item.title: US CDC reports 5,228,817 coronavirus cases
item.description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Friday reported 5,228,817 cases of the new coronavirus, an increase of 52,799 cases from its previous count, and said that the number of deaths had risen by 1,169 to 166,317.

item.title: Nurse na namatay sa COVID-19, P7k lang ang naging hazard pay sa pagiging frontliner
item.description: Kung masusunod ang ipinangako ng Department of Health na P500 na daily hazard pay sa mga health worker, dapat nasa P30,000 ang matatanggap ng naulila ng isang nurse na pumanaw sa COVID-19. Pero dahil sa municipal hospital lang siya nagtrabaho, mahigit P7,000 lang ang nakuha ng kaniyang anak--o katumbas lang ng P64 bawat araw sa kaniyang pagiging frontliner.

item.title: Pray '10 Hail Marys' for national healing from COVID-19 - bishops
item.description: Catholic bishops are calling on the faithful to pray '10 Hail Marys' everyday in schools, seminaries, parishes and communities for healing of the nation from the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), according to a post on the Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines (CBCP) website.

item.title: Healthy kin of COVID-19 cases are ones in this barangay's isolation facility
item.description: “Masikip kasi yung lugar nila, so automatic yun lahat sila isa-swab. Pagkatapos as soon as malaman namin in three to four days yung result, kinuha agad namin yung mga negatives, naiiwan kaagad yung nag-positive,” Francisco said.

item.title: PNP: 41 more personnel test positive for COVID-19; total at 2,798
item.description: The number of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases in the Philippine National Police (PNP) increased to 2,798 on Friday with 41 new infections.

item.title: France virus cases 'growing fastest among young'
item.description: French health authorities warned Thursday that new coronavirus cases were rising fastest among younger people, as the number of confirmed infections per day continued to tick up.

item.title: Health worker na namatay sa COVID-19, pinabayaan nga ba ng ospital na kaniyang pinagsilbihan?
item.description: "Sana diyan na lang sana ako sa Jose Reyes." Ito ang nabanggit ni Judyn Bonn Suerte sa kaniyang video bago siya binawian ng buhay dahil sa komplikasyon na dulot ng COVID-19. Siya ay 41-anyos lang.

item.title: Global COVID-19 cases almost 21M, death toll at 754,649 with more than 12.7M recoveries
item.description: At least 20,962,510 coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases have been registered in 196 countries and territories. Of these, at least 12,789,500 are now considered recovered while at least 754,649 people have died since the disease emerged in China last December, according to a tally from official sources compiled by AFP at 1100 GMT on Friday.

item.title: Radio DJ gunned down in Sorsogon
item.description: A radio disk jockey was shot dead in Bulan, Sorsogon on Thursday night.

item.title: Travel restrictions to be extended at US land borders, DHS says
item.description: The United States will extend to a ban on non-essential travel at land borders with Canada and Mexico for another 30 days as several states struggle to contain a coronavirus outbreak, a top US official confirmed Friday.

item.title: Cainta nurse who died of COVID-19 gets P64 daily hazard pay, daughter says
item.description: “Ang lumalabas sa computation ay P64 a day so napakaliit. Ang problem din kasi dito, yong hospital ay operated by the (local government unit), hindi siya DOH hospital. However, yong mayor nangako siya na naglaan siya ng P14 million para sa hazard pay ng mga health workers. Bakit P7,000 lang?,” Casey Cruz, the nurse's daughter, said.

item.title: Pag-angkat ng manok sa Brazil, itinigil ng Pilipinas dahil sa ulat ng COVID-19 contamination
item.description: Pansamantalang ipinatigil ng Pilipinas ang pagpasok sa bansa ng mga manok na galing sa Brazil dahil sa mga ulat na nakitaan ng COVID-19 ang sample ng frozen chicken wings sa China.

item.title: 19-year-old gamer dies of heart attack in Pangasinan
item.description: A 19-year-old boy passed away after suffering a heart attack while playing computer games in San Fabian, Pangasinan.“Siguro na-excite siya sa paglalaro pero kasama na rin yong puyat at tsaka yong pagod kasi dito mainit kasi nasira electric fan,” Samuel, the boy's father, said.

item.title: Oct. 5 class opening draws mixed reactions from teachers, parents
item.description: The postponement of the opening of School Year 2020-2021 from August 24 to October 5 drew some mixed reactions from teachers and parents, according to Cedric Castillo s Friday report on 24 Oras.

item.title: Asymptomatic close contacts of QC's COVID-19 cases to undergo swab tests
item.description: Asymptomatic close contacts of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases in Quezon City will now have to undergo swab testing as part of the local government s efforts to curb the spread of the virus in the city.
